content:
I have updated the contribution.

Referee
* Changed the execution time limit from 5 seconds to 25 seconds.

Examples
* Added Example 2.

Note
* Added a mention of the "Shortest Palindromic Path" puzzle.

Constraints
* Added "For N ‚â• 9, (startR, startC) is none of (2, 2), (2, N - 1), (N - 1, 2), or (N - 1, N - 1).".
* Added "For odd N ‚â• 9, startR + startC is even.".
* Added "The execution time limit is 25 seconds.".

Cases
* Redesigned the entire set of test cases. For reviewers, Figure 1 depicts the start cells for each N. Blue dots represent the tests, while red crosses represent the validators. Figure 2 depicts the distribution of N relative to the case index.

Figure 1: https://forum.codingame.com/uploads/default/original/4X/a/d/5/ad54ad9051c1c6d525b6cbb1935ad3960a28787a.png
Figure 2: https://forum.codingame.com/uploads/default/original/4X/9/1/e/91e7d6ee297c824dff52a3415723a4e83faeb1ee.png

Goal/Constraints
* Removed "A valid grid is guaranteed to exist." from the Constraints section and added "Under the given constraints, it can be proved that a valid grid always exists." to the Goal section.

Thank you. :)
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Reached only 48% for the moment, rest validator are just time out.
Need to find a super code to compute the missing one.

I have updated the contribution.

* Changed the difficulty from Medium to Hard.
* Modified the start/goal images to ensure they remain clearly visible on large grids.
* Added a result screen to the viewer.
* Changed the font.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
Nice work on making this code and also different type of testing examples. You can say that Difficult, Because beginners are not able to do....
Solved at 43%, you can easily put it at Difficult / Very Difficult level
Very difficult one, i still try to find a solution!

I have updated the contribution.

* Added a note section to the problem statement.
* Changed the appearance of the trail.
* Animated the trail to eliminate the gap between the trail and the star.

This is an interesting puzzle, quite different from the types usually seen on CG.

Also, you did an excellent job on your first attempt at creating a puzzle using the CG SDK! I did't find any issues with the implementation itself. The points below are for improvement rather than bug reports.

Viewer
* I'm not sure whether the viewer animation should leave a trail as it moves along the path. That should make the path clearer, but in any case, it'll probably become difficult to see without zooming in when N grows larger.

Cases
* There aren't any cases where N is a 2-digit odd number. Please add a pair or two.

* For N ‚â• 20, the starting points are consistently very close to the grid edges. Could some of them be positioned further inside?

* None of the visible tests use starting points on the left or right edges. Please update at least one test to include such a scenario. For reference, here's a summary of existing edge/corner starting points:

  ‚Ä¢ Corners: N=4 (Test & Validator), N=30 (Validator)

  ‚Ä¢ Left/right edges: N=6 (Validator)

  ‚Ä¢ Top/bottom edges: N=10 (Test), N=50 (Validator)
  
* From the summary, it appears that N is always even when the starting point is on an edge or at a corner. Would it be possible to include cases with odd N as well?

Thanks.
This is my first time using the CodinGame SDK. Any pointers or suggestions, even on small details, would be greatly appreciated. \(^_^)/

Thank you for your comprehensive feedback.

I have implemented the trail feature as a prototype. I'm not sure if I will replace it with something fancier.

I have redesigned the entire set of test cases to address your points. Note that I have changed the constraint to N ‚â§ 20. During the redesign of the test cases, I realized that reliably generating N=50 grids was more challenging than initially thought.
The new appearance of the trail and the new setting work well. üëç
I have updated the puzzle. The changes to the constraints, test cases, and time limit are significant. Could you resubmit your solution to see if you can get a higher score?

Do you have a working solution, and have you tested that it doesn't time out?

For viewer-enabled puzzles (unlike ordinary puzzles), the time limit is the same across all programming languages. It currently appears to be 5 seconds. Please adjust the limit if this is too short or too long, taking slower languages into account.

Regardless of whether you change it, please make sure to state the time limit in the Constraints section.

Thanks.

I have coded a Python solution that passes all current test cases within the 5-second time limit on the CodinGame IDE. However, I have identified edge cases not covered by the current test set that cause my solution to fail. I will likely make significant changes before marking this contribution as Ready.
Noted. In that case, you may decide whether the time limit should be adjusted after the changes are made.

I have stated the time limit in the Constraints section, along with some significant changes. I have verified that my updated Python solution passes all updated test cases. Could you take another look?

Thank you for sharing the update and inviting me to review it.

Statement
* It appears that not every cell in the grid must be used (as shown in Example 2), which differs from my previous understanding. It may help to state this explicitly in the statement.

* Example 2:

  ‚Ä¢ Consider specifying the palindrome formed, for the players' convenience.

  ‚Ä¢ Consider replacing all letters not used in the path with distinct characters to make the path clearer. For example:

aaaq
rbst
aavb
uaaa

(If you use this grid, the path would need to be updated accordingly.)

Constraints
* I don't recall seeing other CG puzzles with an execution time limit that long (25 seconds). Was this limit chosen based on your Python solution? You mentioned that your solution could pass all test cases for the previous version within 5 seconds. How does your latest code perform on the current version?

Cases
* I noticed five pairs of cases where the test input is identical to the validator. However, since there are 50 pairs in total, this duplication isn't much of an issue.

Thanks again.

Thank you again for your detailed feedback.

Goal
* I have added "Note that not every cell in the grid must be used (as shown in Example 2).".

Example 2
* I have specified the palindrome formed.
* Regarding the path clarity, one purpose of Example 2 is to implicitly demonstrate that the puzzle is solvable using a limited character set. Since players can set the language to PHP and copy-paste the grid to observe the behavior, I don't believe the clarity of the text grid is a major concern.

Constraints
* The limit was indeed chosen based on my Python solution. There are two primary worst case scenarios for execution time. I measured the performance using time.perf_counter in the CodinGame IDE over 10 runs for each case. The results are:

Worst Case 1: min = 3944ms, avg = 8207ms, max = 17931ms
Worst Case 2: min = 4487ms, avg = 9930ms, max = 18115ms

I have set the time limit to 25 seconds to be lenient. I have chosen not to reduce N as it might allow simpler C++ solutions to pass easily.

Cases
* Three pairs (N=5, 7, 19) of them are intentional edge cases that should remain.
* While the other two (N=9, 15) could be adjusted, I'm not sure if it's necessary. I'll keep them as is for now.

Thank you for your reply. I understand your rationale regarding the various matters.

Just to confirm, were the execution times measured *after* the inputs had been read (as that's the practice for CG)?

Good catch. I was including the input reading time. It should have been fine since I wanted to be lenient, but I've remeasured them just in case. The updated results are:

Worst Case 1: min = 1950ms, avg = 6455ms, max = 19649ms
Worst Case 2: min = 1854ms, avg = 8124ms, max = 18920ms

Thank you for pointing that out.

The revised cases look more balanced now. Good work.

The trail is looking good as well. You may try experimenting with colours other than red to see if something fits the starry sky theme better.
